title: Khloe Kardashian says she'll 'never come in-between' Tristan Thompson and their daughter True
text:
She suffered a widely publicized split from her boyfriend Tristan Thompson earlier this year in the wake of multiple cheating scandals.

But that doesn't mean Khloé Kardashian is looking to stifle the 28–year–old Cleveland Cavaliers player's relationship with their daughter True Thompson, one.

The 35–year–old Keeping Up With The Kardashians star vowed she would 'never come in-between' their parental relationship on an episode of Jay Shetty's On Purpose podcast released Monday.

Keeping communication open: Khloé Kardashian, 35, confirmed she would 'never come in-between' her ex Tristan Thompson, 28, and their daughter True, one, during an appearance on the On Purpose podcast Monday; pictured in 2018

Khloé has said it's 'hard' to co-parent with her ex-boyfriend but insists she'll never prevent the basketball star from seeing their daughter because she wants to allow him to have a relationship with her.

Despite Tristan being caught in infidelities during her pregnancy, Khloé didn't end their relationship until February, when he was spotted making out with her sister Kylie Jenner's former best friend Jordyn Woods at a party.

'It's hard, it's not easy for me. It would be easier for me to keep my daughter away and be like, "No, 'cause you hurt me,"' said the reality star.

'But, he never hurt True, him and I have our own relationship, and then Tristan and True have theirs. And I will never come in-between that, I don't believe in that.'

The high road: 'It's hard, it's not easy for me. It would be easier for me to keep my daughter away and be like, "No, 'cause you hurt me,"' said the reality star

Doing the right thing: 'But, he never hurt True, him and I have our own relationship, and then Tristan and True have theirs. And I will never come in-between that, I don't believe in that'

The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star credits her mother Kris Jenner and late father Robert Kardsahian for teaching her how to co-parent, as she says they were 'incredible' at splitting parenting duties.

'I attest that to my parents, [who] were incredible co-parenters, from what I know. My mum and my dad, I'm sure, fought all the time, not around us.'

Kardashian and Jenner (née Houghton) were married from 1978 until their 1991 divorce, though they passed on healthy parenting ideals to their children by remaining good friends until his death in 2003 from esophageal cancer in 2003.

Learning a lesson: Khloé credited her mother Kris Jenner and her late father Robert Kardashian for keeping their disagreements private and modeling strong co-parenting; pictured in January

Staying close: Kris was married to Robert from 1978–1991, though they maintained a strong friendship until his 2003 death from cancer; pictured September 27

Khloé also praised her sister Kourtney Kardashian and her former partner Scott Disick for their ability to co-parent their three children, Mason, nine, Penelope, seven, and Reign, four.

'As long as it's not hurting you in any way... if this was hindering Kourtney's growth or if it hinders my growth, then you also have to put yourself first, because you are in fact taking care of your children.

'But if it's not hindering you or hurting you in any way, I think it's important to work on all relationships.'

Kourtney and the Flip It Like Disick star were together from 2006–2015, though they never tied the knot.

Leading by example: Khloé also praised her sister Kourtney Kardashian and Scott Disick for their ability to co-parent their three children, Mason, nine, Penelope, seven, and Reign, four; pictured in 2013

Though Khloé was concerned about her ex's relationship with her daughter, her own relationship proved to be a struggle over the weekend.

The Good American co-founder shared a hilarious video Sunday afternoon of her daughter's singing Elmo toy which intoned 'la la la' over and over again in a sing-song cadence.

'ALL DAY LONG!!!!' she captioned a video of the bracing toy.
description: Khloé Kardashian confirmed she'd do her best to make sure her daughter True and her ex Tristan Thompson had a meaningful relationship by keeping their own drama separate.
